title: 114_s2353
content: The Act titled "Biodiesel Tax Incentive Reform and Extension Act of 2015" extends and reforms biodiesel tax incentives. The Act "Biodiesel Tax Incentive Reform and Extension Act of 2015" extends current law incentives by amending deadlines for income tax credits and excise tax incentives to March 31, 2016. The Act extends income tax credits and excise tax incentives until March 31, 2016, with guidance for submission of claims provided by the Secretary of the Treasury within 30 days of enactment. The Act extends income tax credits and excise tax incentives until March 31, 2016, with guidance for submission of claims provided by the Secretary of the Treasury within 30 days of enactment. Claims must be paid within 60 days, with interest if delayed. Amendments apply to fuel sold or used after December 31, 2014. Reform of the income tax credit is also addressed. The Act extends income tax credits and excise tax incentives until March 31, 2016, with guidance for submission of claims provided by the Secretary of the Treasury within 30 days of enactment. Claims must be paid within 60 days, with interest if delayed. Amendments apply to fuel sold or used after December 31, 2014. Reform of the income tax credit is also addressed. SEC. 40A. BIODIESEL FUELS CREDIT. The biodiesel fuels credit under section 38 is $1.00 per gallon of biodiesel produced and sold for business use or retail sale. Small biodiesel producers receive an increased credit. The biodiesel producer receives a 10 cent increase in the dollar amount for subsection (a). This applies to the first 15,000,000 gallons produced by any eligible small biodiesel producer. Definitions and special rules are amended for qualified biodiesel mixtures. The term 'biodiesel mixture' refers to a combination of biodiesel and diesel fuel, excluding kerosene. To qualify as a biodiesel mixture, it must be sold or used for business purposes by the producer. If biodiesel is used for a purpose not specified in the regulations, a tax will be imposed based on the applicable rate and the amount of biodiesel used. Rules similar to those for estates and trusts will apply. No credit will be given for biodiesel unless it has a connection to the United States. The tax on biodiesel is imposed if it is not produced in the United States from qualified feedstocks. Qualified feedstocks are those allowable for a fuel with a D-Code of 4. Rules for small biodiesel producers are also outlined in the regulations. The tax on biodiesel is amended by replacing certain subsections with "biodiesel" and updating headings to reflect the change. The tax on biodiesel is amended to replace "agri-biodiesel" with "biodiesel" in certain subsections and headings. Additionally, renewable diesel is defined as liquid fuel derived from biomass that can be used in engines designed for conventional diesel fuel and meets specific grade requirements. Grade No. 1-D or Grade No. 2-D fuel covered by ASTM specification D-975-13a, excluding certain types of fuels like those eligible for tax credits, derived from non-biomass feedstock, or not chemically equivalent to petroleum diesel. Biomass is defined as per its standard meaning. The term 'biomass' is defined as per its standard meaning in relation to renewable diesel fuel derived from biomass meeting specific military or aviation fuel specifications. The term 'biomass' is defined in relation to renewable diesel fuel derived from biomass meeting specific military or aviation fuel specifications. Subsection (g) of section 40A is amended to change the termination date from March 31, 2016, to December 31, 2018. The table of sections for subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 is updated accordingly. The biodiesel production credit is $1.00 for each gallon of biodiesel produced by the taxpayer and sold for use as fuel or in the production of a qualified biodiesel mixture. The biodiesel production credit applies when biodiesel is used as fuel or in a qualified biodiesel mixture. Definitions from section 40A apply, and the subsection does not apply after December 31, 2018. Amendments include a producer registration requirement and recapture provisions. The biodiesel production credit is amended to remove references to biodiesel in certain paragraphs and to add a new paragraph regarding the use of biodiesel for non-qualifying purposes. The biodiesel production credit is amended to impose a tax on biodiesel used for non-qualifying purposes at a rate of $1 per gallon. Amendments are made to section 6426(f) and 6426(i) to reflect these changes. The biodiesel production credit is amended to require biodiesel produced in the US from qualified feedstocks to be eligible for the credit. Clerical amendments are made to section 6426 regarding alcohol fuel mixtures, biodiesel production, and alternative fuel mixtures. The item in the table of sections for subchapter B of chapter 65 is amended to include biodiesel production credit. Section 6427 is amended to remove the biodiesel mixture credit and add a new paragraph for biodiesel production credit. The biodiesel production credit is paid by the Secretary to a person who produces and sells biodiesel. The amendment includes adding biodiesel production credit in the table of sections for subchapter B of chapter 65. The biodiesel production credit amendment includes changing the definition of biodiesel and extending the effective date to December 31, 2018. The Secretary of the Treasury must issue guidance within 30 days of enactment, and the amendments apply to fuel sold or used after March 31, 2016.
